section.title: Use a team project
section.para: Team projects use synchronization mechanisms between project members.

Once an OmegaT team project has been set up on a server, the project manager sends members the information they need to access it. This can be a URL giving the location of the project, or an omegat.project file.
Downloading the project creates a copy on the translator's computer that only needs to be opened locally to synchronize with the server.
Repository credentials are stored in the file and can be deleted from the preferences.

Since synchronization takes place every three minutes by default, one project member may translate or modify a segment that has already been translated by another member, but not yet synchronized. When that happens, members have to select the appropriate translation.

Members can take turns translating and reviewing the files. The Search function offers a number of useful options to filter the content of the files. For example, members can have the Editor pane show translations made by a given person, or contents translated before or after a given time, or combinations thereof.

listitem.para: From a URL
Use to bring up the Download Team Project dialog.

Enter the URL provided by the project manager in the Repository URL: field at the top of the dialog, and specify a folder for the project in the New Local Project Folder: field. Leave the Default branch option checked unless the project manager has provided instructions for using a custom branch.
From an omegat.project file
Put the omegat.project file in an empty folder, and open it in OmegaT. The project will automatically be downloaded to the folder containing that file.

note.para: Servers generally use two main types of authentication: entering a username/password, or SSH.

If the server relies on username/password authentication, OmegaT will present you with an Authentication dialog to enter your username and password either when you first download the project or later on in the process. OmegaT will then remember your credentials for that specific project unless you explicitly delete them. See the preferences for details.

If the server uses SSH authentication, make sure you update your SSH configuration to include that server before attempting to download the project, otherwise you will get an authentication error and the project will fail to load.

Some hosting services require you to generate a passphrase or other form of access token in addition to your password. In such cases, enter that passphrase or token when OmegaT asks for your password.
If you use multiple projects on the same server, you will only be asked to enter your credentials once for that server.

listitem.para: Synchronizing the project adds translations made by all team members to local copies of the project. Only the contents of the two following files are synchronized:
During synchronization, all other local files are overwritten with the versions on the remote server, except for omegat.project (see below).

OmegaT synchronizes a team project when it is opened, reloaded, closed or saved. This means the automatic save function also regularly synchronizes local versions with the version on the server at the interval specified in the preference.

As in regular local projects, the configuration of the team project is defined by the contents of the omegat.project file and the optional use of special files for project-specific filters or segmentation rules.
The first time the project is downloaded, OmegaT retrieves the omegat.project file from the server. This file defines the following parameters:
Basic project configuration: Source and languages, tokenizers, and the project folder hierarchy.
In a team project, the basic configuration parameters of the local project are always overridden by the configuration on the server originally set by the project manager.
See the how-to for details.
If no custom mappings have been defined for the remote project, but local mappings have been customized, the local settings are preserved without affecting the settings on the server.
If the remote project contains custom mappings, but the local project does not, the mappings from the server are applied to the local project.
If the remote project specifies a URL protocol and you download it using a different protocol, your local configuration will be preserved.
For example, many hosting services support access to the same repository using either the SSHâ€¯+Git or https protocol. OmegaT will respect the local protocol selection.
If you first download the remote project using an omegat.project file provided by the project manager, OmegaT will use the mappings in that file, if any.

If there is a conflict between the remote and local versions of the omegat.project file and the local version is overwritten, OmegaT creates a backup file called omegat.project.YYYYMMDDhhmm.bak. OmegaT creates up to ten backup files, and older backups are automatically deleted in turn.

warning.para: Remember that any modifications to local project configuration files will be overwritten by the versions on the server when the project is synchronized.

listitem.para: Unless special mappings or , have been set up all source files are shared by all team members, and any changes made to the local source files are overwritten the next time the project is synchronized, unless they are committed to the server using the command.

warning.para: Since changes to the source files affect all members, use that command with caution and only in accordance with the guidelines and workflow established for the project by the project manager.

listitem.para: After you generate the target, files use the command to add them to the server if the project manager has requested you to do so. Committing the target files also uploads the statistics files to the server.

This task normally has to be performed by the project manager, since files in a team project are restored the next time the project is synchronized. This means users cannot delete from OmegaT or the local file system unless the project manager removes them from the server.
You can open a team project and work on it offline. All changes will be synchronized the next time a connection is available.
If there are any conflicts at that time, OmegaT will present a dialog to let you choose the correct version.
There are two ways to work offline:
Disconnect from the network before opening the project.
Open the project from the command line with the --no-team option. See the section for details.
